chinese: put wallpaper onto the walls of a room 给（房间）糊墙纸
examples: e.g. Never mind the stains on the walls in the bedroom. We will [[wallpaper]] the rooms this weekend anyway.

chinese: (fml.) increase the effects or strength of sth. 增强
examples: e.g. You might practice gratitude, which is necessary to empower your mind and [[amplify]] your power of attraction.

chinese: jump into deep water with your head and arms going in first 跳水
examples: e.g. It was so hot that the children took off their clothes and [[dived]] into the swimming pool.

chinese: (fml.) although 虽然；尽管
examples: e.g. Charles' letters were published against all odds, albeit in a somewhat abbreviated (缩写的) form.

chinese: respected for being honest or for doing good work 有声望的；信誉佳的
examples: e.g. If you have a fire alarm fitted, make sure it is done by a [[reputable]] company.

chinese: [U] the medical practice of changing the appearance of people's faces or bodies, either to improve their appearance or to repair injuries 整形手术；整形外科
[C] (BrE also speciality) 1) a branch of medicine or surgery 医学专科；专外科
examples: e.g. Emergency medicine is one of the most important [[specialties]].；e.g. In a job interview, it is advisable to talk about your [[specialty]] or key strengths that are relevant to the company's needs.

chinese: 2) a subject or job that you know a lot about or have a lot of experience of 专业；专长
examples: e.g. Emergency medicine is one of the most important [[specialties]].；e.g. In a job interview, it is advisable to talk about your [[specialty]] or key strengths that are relevant to the company's needs.

chinese: [C] a doctor specially trained to perform surgery 外科医生
examples: e.g. His finger was cut off when he caught it in a machine, but the [[surgeon]] was able to sew it back on.

chinese: vi.(mainly AmE) serve as an intern 做实习医生（或实习生）
examples: e.g. I [[interned]] at a clinic during the first summer vacation after I graduated from high school.；e.g. She refused to be treated by an [[intern]] and demanded to see a qualified doctor.；e.g. John once worked as an [[intern]] for a private detective to satisfy his curiosity.

chinese: n. [C]1) (BrE houseman) sb. who has nearly finished training as a doctor and is working in a hospital 实习医生
examples: e.g. I [[interned]] at a clinic during the first summer vacation after I graduated from high school.；e.g. She refused to be treated by an [[intern]] and demanded to see a qualified doctor.；e.g. John once worked as an [[intern]] for a private detective to satisfy his curiosity.

chinese: 2) sb., esp. a student, who works for a short time in a particular job in order to gain experience 实习生
examples: e.g. I [[interned]] at a clinic during the first summer vacation after I graduated from high school.；e.g. She refused to be treated by an [[intern]] and demanded to see a qualified doctor.；e.g. John once worked as an [[intern]] for a private detective to satisfy his curiosity.

chinese: [C] 手术室
involving or relating to treatment intended to restore or improve a person's appearance 整容的
examples: e.g. [[Cosmetic]] surgery is an extreme way of modifying one's looks.

chinese: 1) a mark that a school student gets as a reward for good work or behavior （学校对学业或表现优异学生的评分）优，优秀
examples: e.g. Artistic [[merit]] scholarships require that applicants excel in a given artistic area.；e.g. Tonight's meeting will weigh up the relative [[merits]] of the two candidates.

chinese: 2) an advantage or good feature of sth. 长处；优点
examples: e.g. Artistic [[merit]] scholarships require that applicants excel in a given artistic area.；e.g. Tonight's meeting will weigh up the relative [[merits]] of the two candidates.

chinese: [U] 神经生物学
[U] 生理学
(also dread) (only before noun) making you feel afraid or anxious — often used humorously 可怕的，令人忧虑的（常为幽默用法）
examples: e.g. For decades in American households the most [[dreaded]] morning sound was that of an alarm clock.

chinese: [C] (AmE) a period of training spent in a hospital by a young doctor in order to finish their medical qualification 医生实习期
examples: e.g. The diligent young man will be a genuine asset to any hospital that offers him an [[internship]] position.

chinese: (only before noun) of, relating to, or used in surgery 外科的；外科手术（用）的
examples: e.g. Most people who ultimately turn to a [[surgical]] solution have tried everything else.

chinese: (~s) [pl.] 手术服
[C] a covering for all or part of the face, worn to hide or protect it 面具；面罩
examples: e.g. We had to wear a protective [[mask]] when handling goods in the awfully dusty environment.

chinese: [C] a restaurant where customers serve themselves from a counter and pay before eating 自助餐馆；自助食堂
examples: e.g. Even if you do not buy your food in the [[cafeteria]], you can use the tables to have meetings or to study.

chinese: [U] intense and eager enjoyment, interest, or approval 热心；热情
examples: e.g. One of the good things about teaching young children is that their [[enthusiasm]] never lets you down.

chinese: 1) the action of putting sth. into operation 应用
examples: e.g. Students learned the practical [[application]] of the theory they had been taught in the classroom.；e.g. We regret to inform you that your [[application]] has not been accepted because it was received after the deadline.

chinese: 2) a formal request to an authority for sth. 申请
examples: e.g. Students learned the practical [[application]] of the theory they had been taught in the classroom.；e.g. We regret to inform you that your [[application]] has not been accepted because it was received after the deadline.

chinese: [C] a set of clothes worn together, esp. for a particular occasion or purpose 全套服装
examples: e.g. When you're wearing a loud (花哨的) polka-dot shirt, you need to keep the rest of your [[outfit]] quiet.

chinese: [C] a piece of furniture like a large cupboard that you hang clothes in 衣柜；衣橱
[C, U] the machinery in a vehicle that turns engine power into movement forward or backward 排挡
in a way that is severe and sudden or has very noticeable effects 激烈地；大幅度地
examples: e.g. Our communication has changed [[drastically]] in the past decade owing to information technology.

chinese: (make sth.) move in a twisting or spiraling pattern （使）打旋；（使）旋动
examples: e.g. He was trying to digest the news by himself, the cigarette smoke [[swirling]] around him.

chinese: vt.reveal (confidential information) to sb. 透露
examples: e.g. The police officer refused to [[spill]] the witness' private information to the reporters to protect her security.；e.g. Let's see if we could pour the juice through the narrow opening of the bottle without [[spilling]] it.

chinese: v.(cause to) flow over the edge of a container, esp. unintentionally （使）溢出；泼出
examples: e.g. The police officer refused to [[spill]] the witness' private information to the reporters to protect her security.；e.g. Let's see if we could pour the juice through the narrow opening of the bottle without [[spilling]] it.

chinese: 1) reasonable or justified 合理的；正当的
examples: e.g. He claimed that the restaurant bill was a [[legitimate]] business expense and should be covered by the company.；e.g. The international community urged the army of the country to give power back to the [[legitimate]] government.

chinese: 2) allowed by law 合法的
examples: e.g. He claimed that the restaurant bill was a [[legitimate]] business expense and should be covered by the company.；e.g. The international community urged the army of the country to give power back to the [[legitimate]] government.

chinese: n.[C] a book of instructions, esp. for operating a machine or learning a subject; a handbook 说明书；手册
examples: e.g. The computer comes with a 600-page instruction [[manual]] that is not at all user-friendly.；e.g. The floors of all campus buildings are equipped with [[manual]] fire alarm systems.

chinese: a.of or done with the hands 手工的；用手的
examples: e.g. The computer comes with a 600-page instruction [[manual]] that is not at all user-friendly.；e.g. The floors of all campus buildings are equipped with [[manual]] fire alarm systems.

chinese: [C] a very famous model 超级名模
examples: e.g. She became a [[supermodel]] and went to the top soon after she was discovered by a talent scout (星探).

chinese: (cause to) turn over with a sudden sharp movement （使）快速翻转
examples: e.g. I lost my place in my book when the pages [[flipped]] over in the wind.

chinese: very clearly stated and easy to understand 明白的；无疑问的
examples: e.g. I want to make one thing crystal clear — I do not agree with these proposals.

chinese: start doing sth. eagerly 热切地开始
examples: e.g. George [[dived]] into his application for an overseas postgraduate program as soon as he finished his third year at college.

chinese: tolerate or accept sth., even though it is unpleasant or unsatisfactory 容忍
examples: e.g. They had [[put]] up with behavior from their son which they would not have tolerated from anyone else.

chinese: start to ring loudly or make a loud noise 发出响声
examples: e.g. I overslept and missed my early morning class because my alarm clock did not [[go]] off as usual today.

chinese: happen as a regular or predictable event 如期而至
examples: e.g. I hope to be qualified to compete when the World Championship [[comes]] around next year.

chinese: stop trying to do or achieve sth. 放弃（努力）
examples: e.g. If your weight-loss goals are beyond reach, you're likely to feel frustrated and [[give]] up on your dieting plans.

chinese: (BrE shift gear) suddenly change what you are doing 突然改变方式
examples: e.g. The first half of the movie made the audience fall out of their chairs laughing, but then it [[shifted]] gears.

chinese: try sth. in order to see if you like it or if it's suitable 试探
examples: e.g. Many international companies want to [[test]] the water in China as they see the huge investment potential.

english: shut / close the door on sth.
chinese: make it impossible for sth. to happen, esp. a plan or a solution to a problem 把···拒之门外
examples: e.g. There are fears that this latest move might have [[shut]] the door on a peaceful solution.

chinese: tell sb. about sth. unpleasant that will affect or upset them 把坏消息告诉某人
examples: e.g. We must [[break]] the news to all of you that the event is cancelled because of lack of funds.

chinese: tell people secret information 泄露秘密
examples: e.g. We'll all be there at 6 for the surprise party — now don't [[spill]] the beans unless you want to spoil the fun.

chinese: look quickly at the pages of a magazine, book, etc. 浏览
examples: e.g. I quickly [[flipped]] through the survey report while I was waiting for the conference to kick off.

chinese: if sth. is right under sb.'s nose, they cannot see it even though it is very close to them （就）在某人眼皮底下（却看不见）
examples: e.g. I've been looking for my keys for ages and they were right under my nose all the time.

chinese: （美国）马里兰大学
长岛（位于美国纽约附近）
亚瑟 • 埃尔戈特（美国时尚摄影师）
